arm_group.description: Patients who have received a MAKOplasty® robotically guided unilateral knee arthroplasty (UKA) and received a medial MCK onlay implant.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the survivorship rate of robotic assisted medial
      partial knee replacement at a two, five, and ten years.

clinical_study.brief_title: Survivorship and Outcomes of Robot Assisted Medial Partial Knee Replacement

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the survivorship rate of robotically guided
      MultiCompartmental Knee system (MCK) medial onlay Unilateral Knee Arthroplasty (UKA)
      implants at a two, five, and ten year follow up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  over 21 years of age

          -  underwent primary robotically guided UKA and received a medial MCK onlay implant by
             the investigating surgeon

          -  at least 24 months post-operative

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients will be excluded from participation in the study if they are cognitively
             unable to answer study questions

study_pop.textblock:
Patients who underwent a MAKOplasty procedure by the investigating surgeon and received a
        medial MCK onlay implant.

intervention.description: A robot guided medical Unicompartmental knee arthroplasty (UKA) is a procedure to replace only the medial tibiofemoral compartment of the knee.

clinical_study.official_title: Survivorship and Outcomes of Robotically Assisted Medial UKA

primary_outcome.description: Survivorship of components is defined as knee implant device(s) remaining in patient.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Survivorship of components is defined as knee implant device(s) remaining in patient.
Survivorship of components is defined as knee implant device(s) remaining in patient.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
